pli-tv-pvr1.2:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-pvr1.2:0.4: The section on how many offenses
pli-tv-pvr1.2:0.5: 1. The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.1: (1) For having sexual intercourse, how many kinds of offences does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.2: One commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.3: if one has sexual intercourse with an undecomposed corpse, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.4: if one has sexual intercourse with a mostly decomposed corpse, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.5: if one inserts the penis without touching into a wide open mouth, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.1: (2) For stealing, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.2: One commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.3: if, intending to steal, one steals something worth five _māsaka_ coins or more than five _māsakas_, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.4: if, intending to steal, one steals something worth more than one _māsaka_ coin but less than five _māsakas_, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.5: if, intending to steal, one steals something worth one _māsaka_ coin or less than one _māsaka_, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.1: (3) For intentionally killing a human being, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.2: One commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.3: if one digs a pit for people, thinking, “Falling into it someone will die,” one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.4: if the person experiences pain after falling, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.5: if the person dies, one commits an offense entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.1: (4) For untruthfully and groundlessly boasting about a superhuman quality, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.2: One commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.3: if, having bad desires, overcome by desire, one claims a non-existent, unreal superhuman quality, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.4: if one says, “Whatever monk lives in your dwelling is a perfected one,” and the listener understands, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.5: if the listener does not understand, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:5.1: The four offenses entailing expulsion are finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.0: 2. The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.1: (1) (…) For emitting semen by means of effort, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.2: if one intends and makes an effort, and semen is emitted, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.3: if one intends and makes an effort, but semen is not emitted, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.4: the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:7.1: (2) For making physical contact with a woman, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:7.2: if one touches body with body, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:7.3: if one touches what is connected to the body with the body, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:7.4: if one touches what is connected to the body with what is connected to the body, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.1: (3) For speaking indecently to a woman, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.2: if, referring to the anus or the vagina, one praises and disparages, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.3: if, referring to any part below the collar bone but above the knees, apart from the anus or the vagina, one praises and disparages, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.4: if, referring to anything connected to the body, one praises and disparages, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.1: (4) For commending the satisfaction of one’s own desires, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.2: if one encourages a woman to satisfy one’s own desires, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.3: if one encourages a eunuch to satisfy one’s own desires, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.4: if one encourages an animal to satisfy one’s own desires, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.1: (5) For acting as a matchmaker, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.2: if one accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.3: if one accepts the mission, and finds out the response, but does not report back, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.4: if one accepts the mission, but neither finds out the response, nor reports back, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:11.1: (6) For having a hut built by means of begging, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:11.2: if one is having it built, then the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:11.3: when there is one piece left to complete the hut, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:11.4: when the last piece is finished, one commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:12.1: (7) For having a large dwelling built, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:12.2: if one is having it built, then the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:12.3: when there is one piece left to complete the hut, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:12.4: when the last piece is finished, one commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:13.1: (8) For groundlessly charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:13.2: if, without having obtained his permission, one speaks with the aim of making him leave the monastic life, one commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:13.3: if, having obtained his permission, one speaks with the aim of abusing him, one commits an offense for abusive speech.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:14.1: (9) For charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, using an unrelated legal issue as a pretext, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:14.2: if, without having obtained his permission, one speaks with the aim of making him leave the monastic life, one commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:14.3: if, having obtained his permission, one speaks with the aim of abusing him, one commits an offense for abusive speech.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:15.1: (10) For not stopping when pressed up to three times, a monk who is pursuing schism in the Sangha commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:15.2: after the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:15.3: after each of the first two announcements, he commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:15.4: when the last announcement is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:16.1: (11) For not stopping when pressed up to three times, monks who side with a monk who is pursuing schism commit three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:16.2: after the motion, they commit an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:16.3: after each of the first two announcements, they commit a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:16.4: when the last announcement is finished, they commit an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:17.1: (12) For not stopping when pressed up to three times, a monk who is difficult to correct commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:17.2: after the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:17.3: after each of the first two announcements, he commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:17.4: when the last announcement is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:18.1: (13) For not stopping when pressed up to three times, a monk who is a corrupter of families commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:18.2: after the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:18.3: after each of the first two announcements, he commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:18.4: when the last announcement is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:19.1: The thirteen rules entailing suspension are finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:20.0.2: 4.1 The sub-chapter on the robe-making season
pli-tv-pvr1.2:20.1: (1) For keeping an extra robe more than ten days, one commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:20.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:21.1: (2) For staying apart from one’s three robes for one day, one commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:21.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:22.1: (3) For receiving out-of-season robe-cloth and then keeping it for more than a month, one commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:22.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:23.1: (4) For getting an unrelated nun to wash a used robe, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:23.2: when he is getting her to wash it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:23.3: when he has got it washed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:24.1: (5) For receiving a robe from the hand of an unrelated nun, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:24.2: when he is taking it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:24.3: when he has taken it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:25.1: (6) For asking an unrelated male or female householder for a robe, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:25.2: when he asks, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:25.3: when he has asked, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:26.1: (7) For asking an unrelated male or female householder for too much robe-cloth, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:26.2: when he asks, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:26.3: when he has asked, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:27.1: (8) For approaching, without first being invited, an unrelated householder and specifying the kind of robe one wants, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:27.2: when he is specifying it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:27.3: when he has specified it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:28.1: (9) For approaching, without first being invited, unrelated householders and specifying the kind of robe one wants, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:28.2: when he is specifying it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:28.3: when he has specified it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:29.1: (10) For getting a robe after prompting more than three times and standing more than six times, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:29.2: when he is getting it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:29.3: when he has got it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:30.1: The first sub-chapter on the robe-making season is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:31.1: (11) For having a blanket made that contains silk, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:31.2: when he is having it made, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:31.3: when he has had it made, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:32.1: (12) For having a blanket made entirely of black wool, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:32.2: when he is having it made, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:32.3: when he has had it made, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:33.1: (13) For having a new blanket made without using one measure of white wool and one measure of brown, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:33.2: when he is having it made, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:33.3: when he has had it made, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:34.1: (14) For having a blanket made every year, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:34.2: when he is having it made, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:34.3: when he has had it made, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:35.1: (15) For having a new sitting-blanket made without incorporating a one-standard-hand-span piece from the border of an old blanket, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:35.2: when he is having it made, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:35.3: when he has had it made, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:36.1: (16) For receiving wool and then taking it more than 40 kilometers, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:36.2: when he goes beyond 40 kilometers with the first foot, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:36.3: when he goes beyond with the second foot, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:37.1: (17) For getting an unrelated nun to wash wool, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:37.2: when he is getting her to wash it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:37.3: when he has got it washed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:38.1: (18) For receiving money, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:38.2: when he is taking it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:38.3: when he has taken it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:39.1: (19) For trading with money in various ways, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:39.2: when he is trading, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:39.3: when he has traded, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:40.1: (20) For bartering in various ways, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:40.2: when he is bartering, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:40.3: when he has bartered, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:41.1: The second sub-chapter on silk is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:42.1: (21) For keeping an extra bowl over ten days, one commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:42.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:43.1: (22) For exchanging a bowl with less than five mends for a new bowl, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:43.2: when he is exchanging it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:43.3: when he has exchanged it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:44.1: (23) For receiving medicines and then keeping them for more than seven days, one commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:44.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:45.1: (24) For looking for a rainy-season robe when there is more than a month left of the hot season, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:45.2: when he is looking for it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:45.3: when he has looked for it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:46.1: (25) For giving away a robe to a monk and then taking it back in anger, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:46.2: when he is taking it back, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:46.3: when he has taken it back, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:47.1: (26) For asking for thread and then having weavers weave robe-cloth, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:47.2: when he is having it woven, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:47.3: when he has had it woven, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:48.1: (27) For going, without first being invited, to an unrelated householder’s weavers and then specifying the kind of robe-cloth one wants, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:48.2: when he is specifying it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:48.3: when he has specified it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:49.1: (28) For receiving a haste-cloth and then keeping it beyond the robe season, one commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:49.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:50.1: (29) For storing one of one’s three robes in an inhabited area and then staying apart from it for more than six days, one commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:50.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:51.1: (30) For diverting to oneself material support that one knows is intended for the Sangha, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:51.2: when he is diverting it, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:51.3: when he has diverted it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:52.1: The third sub-chapter on bowls is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:52.2: The thirty rules on relinquishment and confession are finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.0.1: 5. The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.1: (1) For lying in full awareness, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.2: For lying in full awareness, one commits five kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.3: if, having bad desires, overcome by desire, one claims a non-existent, unreal superhuman quality, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.4: if one groundlessly charges a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.5: if one says, “Whatever monk lives in your dwelling is a perfected one,” and the listener understands, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.6: if the listener does not understand, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.7: if one lies in full awareness, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:54.1: (2) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:54.2: if one , one commits an offense entailing confession;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:54.3: if he insults one who is not ordained there is an offence of wrong-doing. [2]
pli-tv-pvr1.2:55.1: (3) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:55.2: if one , one commits an offense entailing confession;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:55.3: if he brings slander against one who is not ordained there is an offence of wrong-doing. [3]
pli-tv-pvr1.2:56.1: (4) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:56.2: if he makes him speak there is an offence of wrong-doing in (the) action;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:56.3: if one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:57.1: (5) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:57.2: if he lies down in the action there is an offence of wrong-doing;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:57.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:58.1: (6) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:58.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:59.1: (7) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:59.3: if one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:60.1: (8) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:60.2: if he speaks there is an offence of wrong-doing in the action;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:60.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:61.1: (9) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:61.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:62.1: (10) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:62.2: if he digs there is an offence of wrong-doing in the action;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:62.3: if one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:63.1: The first sub-chapter on lying is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:64.1: (11) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:64.2: if he destroys there is an offence of wrong-doing in (each) action;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:64.3: if one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:65.1: (12) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:65.2: if evasion is not laid on him but he shelves the question by asking another there is an offence of wrong-doing;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:65.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:66.1: (13) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:66.2: while he is making someone look down on there is an offence of wrong-doing in the action;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:66.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:67.1: (14) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:67.2: if he makes the first foot go further than a stone’s throw there is an offence of wrong-doing;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:67.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:68.1: (15) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:68.2: if he makes the first foot go further than the fence there is an offence of wrong-doing;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:68.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:69.1: (16) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:69.2: as he is lying down there is an offence of wrong-doing in (each) action;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:69.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:70.1: (17) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:70.2: as he is throwing out there is an offence of wrong-doing in (each) action;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:70.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:71.1: (18) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:71.2: while he is sitting down there is an offence of wrong-doing in (each) action;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:71.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:72.1: (19) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:72.2: while he is determining there is an offence of wrong-doing in (each) action;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:72.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:73.1: (20) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:73.2: while he is sprinkling there is an offence of wrong-doing in (each) action;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:73.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:74.1: The second sub-chapter on plants is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:75.1: (21) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:75.2: while he is exhorting there is an offence of wrong-doing in (each) action;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:75.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:76.1: (22) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:76.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:77.1: (23) For , one commits two kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:77.3: when one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:78.1: (24) For , one commits two kinds of offences:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.0: 5.7 The sub-chapter on containing living beings
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.1: (61) Intentionally depriving a living thing of life how many offences does he fall into?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.2: For , one commits four kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.3: if he digs a pitfall not on purpose (for a certain man) and thinks,
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.4: “Whoever falls into it will die” there is an offence of wrong-doing;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.5: if a man, falling into it, dies there is an offence involving Defeat;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.6: if a _yakkha_ or a _peta_ or an animal in human form, falling into it, dies there is a grave offence;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.7: if one , one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.8: Intentionally depriving a living thing of life he falls into these four offences. [61]

pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.0: 6. The chapter on offenses entailing acknowledgment
pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.1: Eating solid food or soft food, having accepted it with his own hand from the hand of a nun who is not a relation (and) has entered among the houses, how many offences does he fall into?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.2: Eating … he falls into two offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.3: as he accepts it thinking, “I will eat,” there is an offence of wrong-doing;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.4: for every mouthful there is an offence to be confessed.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.5: Eating … he falls into these two offences. [1]
pli-tv-pvr1.2:155.1: Eating without restraining a nun who is giving directions he falls into two offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:156.1: Eating solid food or soft food among families agreed upon as learners, having accepted it with his own hand he falls into two offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:157.1: Eating solid food or soft food in forest lodgings, not announced beforehand, having accepted it with his own hand within a monastery, how many offences does he fall into?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:157.2: Eating … he falls into two offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:157.3: as he accepts it thinking, “I will eat” …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:157.5: Eating … in forest lodgings he falls into these two offences. [4]
pli-tv-pvr1.2:158.1: Concluded are the four offences to be Confessed
pli-tv-pvr1.2:159.1: Dressing, out of disrespect, with the inner robe hanging down in front or behind, how many offences does he fall into?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:159.2: Dressing, out of disrespect … he falls into one offence:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:159.4: Dressing, out of disrespect … he falls into this one offence. [1]
pli-tv-pvr1.2:160.1: Out of disrespect putting on the upper robe hanging down in front or behind, he falls into one offence:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:161.1: Out of disrespect going (sitting down) amid the houses having uncovered the body, he falls into one offence
pli-tv-pvr1.2:163.1: Out of disrespect going (sitting down) amid the houses making play with hand or foot …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:165.1: Out of disrespect going (sitting down) amid the houses looking about …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:167.1: Out of disrespect going (sitting down) amid the houses with (the robes) lifted up …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:169.1: The First Division: that on All Round
pli-tv-pvr1.2:170.1: Out of disrespect going (sitting down) amid the houses with loud laughter …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:172.1: Out of disrespect going (sitting down) amid the houses making a loud noise, a great noise …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:174.1: Out of disrespect going (sitting down) amid the houses swaying the body …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:176.1: Out of disrespect going (sitting down) amid the houses swaying the arms …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:178.1: Out of disrespect going (sitting down) amid the houses swaying the head …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:180.1: The Second Division: that on Loud Laughter
pli-tv-pvr1.2:181.1: Out of disrespect going (sitting down) amid the houses with the arms akimbo …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:183.1: Out of disrespect going (sitting down) amid the houses muffled up …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:185.1: Out of disrespect going amid the houses crouching down on the heels …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:186.1: Out of disrespect sitting down amid the houses lolling …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:187.1: Out of disrespect accepting almsfood inattentively …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:188.1: Out of disrespect accepting almsfood while looking about here and there …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:189.1: Out of disrespect accepting much curry only …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:190.1: Out of disrespect accepting heaped-up almsfood …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:191.1: The Third Division: that on Arms Akimbo
pli-tv-pvr1.2:192.1: Out of disrespect eating almsfood inattentively …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:193.1: while looking about here and there …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:195.1: Out of disrespect eating much curry only …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:196.1: Out of disrespect eating almsfood having chosen from the top …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:197.1: Out of disrespect covering up the curry or the condiment with conjey …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:198.1: Out of disrespect eating curry or conjey having asked for it for oneself if one is not ill …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:199.1: Out of disrespect looking at the bowls of others captious-mindedly …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:200.1: Out of disrespect making up a large mouthful …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:201.1: Out of disrespect making up a long morsel (of food) …
pli-tv-pvr1.2:202.1: The Fourth Division: that on Almsfood
